column4: Google weighed security  free speech in move to stream Sony film
column5: Google Inc said on Wednesday it weighed the security implications of screening the Sony Pictures film  "The Interview " a comedy whose depiction of the assassination of North Korea's leader was blamed for a massive cyberattack.

column5: Amazon.com Inc said on Friday it drew more than 10 million new members to its Prime shipping and digital content service over the holidays and intends to offer one-hour shipping to more cities in 2015.

column4: Amazon says 10 mln new members try Prime this holiday season
column5: Dec 26 Amazon.com Inc said more than 10 million new members worldwide tried its Prime subscription service for the first time during the current holiday season.

column4: Tesla's new Roadster to cover two-thirds more miles per charge
column5: U.S. electric car maker Tesla Motors Inc will relaunch its Roadster model with a new battery pack that will increase the distance the car can travel on a single charge by nearly two-thirds to more than 400 miles.

column4: U.S. retailers miss fewer Christmas deadlines -early surveys
column5: SAN FRANCISCO  Dec 26 Major U.S. retailers missed fewer Christmas deliveries this year  according to two small  early surveys released on Friday  partly reflecting a year's worth of investments made to avoid 2013's last-minute shipping debacle.

column4: Indian shares edge higher; tech stocks gain
column5: MUMBAI  Dec 26 Indian shares closed higher on Friday  snapping a two-day losing streak  led by technology stocks such as Infosys on a weaker rupee while broader sentiment was tepid as investors kept away from risky bets ahead of the year-end holidays.

column4: Women's apparel  dining drive U.S. holiday sales: MasterCard
column5: U.S. retail sales rose 5.5 percent from the day after Thanksgiving through Christmas Eve as solid demand for women's apparel  jewelry and casual dining offset surprisingly sluggish sales of electronics  MasterCard said in its holiday spending report.

column5: MOSCOW  Dec 26 International credit and debit card company Mastercard has stopped serving bank cards being used in Crimea  RIA news agency quoted the company as saying on Friday.

column4: McDonald's fries back on the menu in all sizes in Japan
column5: TOKYO  Dec 26 McDonald's customers in Japan will be able to order french fries in all sizes again from next month  after the fast-food chain limited sales to small servings because of import delays.

column4: TABLE-Peru gold output up for second straight month in November
column5: LIMA  Dec 26 Gold output in Peru rose for the second month in a row on the year as output from Newmont Mining Corp's Yanacocha mine soared  the government said on Friday.

column4: Petrobras hit with U.S. class action suit over $98 billion in securities
column5: Brazil's state-run oil company Petroleo Brasileiro SA and some of its executives were hit with a U.S. class action lawsuit by investors in $98 billion of the company's securities over an alleged kickback and bribery scheme.

column4: Petrobras cleared to start production at Buzios field

column4: 'The Interview' makes first million in roller-coaster release
column5: LOS ANGELES "The Interview" took in more than $1 million in a limited Christmas Day release  a decent start for the raunchy comedy that appeared dead after Sony Pictures pulled it from theaters last week following a devastating cyberattack blamed on North Korea.
